definitions.definition: Beneath the surface of the water ; of or pertaining to the region beneath the water surface.
examples: He was a pioneer in underwater exploration.

definitions.definition: Beneath the water line of a vessel .
examples: When the ship was brought into dry dock, it was found that she had underwater damage.

definitions.definition: Having negative equity ; owing more on an asset than its market value.
examples: We've been underwater on our mortgage ever since the housing crash.

definitions.definition: Of an option , having a strike price higher ( call options ) or lower ( put options ) than the current market price of the underlying asset or financial product; for example, an option to buy shares at $20 when the current market price is $15.

main_definition: ( not comparable ) Beneath the surface of the water ; of or pertaining to the region beneath the water surface.
secondary_definitions: ( nautical ) Beneath the water line of a vessel .
( finance ) Having negative equity ; owing more on an asset than its market value.

( finance ) Of an option , having a strike price higher ( call options ) or lower ( put options ) than the current market price of the underlying asset or financial product; for example, an option to buy shares at $20 when the current market price is $15.
